items.title: Mahindra sets sight on renewable power, forms Ultrogen Hybren to focus on green energy and storage systems
items.description: Ultrogen Hybren will be a subsidiary of Mahindra Susten, a subsidiary of Mahindra Holdings (MHL), the company informed through an exchange filing on December 29. The company will aspire to be an Independent Power Producer (IPP).

items.title: Sectors and stocks for January based on seasonality analysis
items.description: Seasonality analysis is a powerful tool that helps traders and investors identify recurring patterns in stock, sector, and index performances.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade Jubilant Foodworks, Ipca Labs, Paytm, Welspun Corp, Campus Activewear, and others on December 30?
items.description: The market is expected to remain rangebound with a positive bias in the upcoming sessions. Below are some trading ideas for the near term.

items.title: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade - First Tick
items.description: Wall Street closed on a weak note last week, however, most Asian markets bucked the trend and moved higher on the penultimate trading day of 2024. Trends from the GIFT Nifty suggest a muted start for the domestic market.

items.title: Live: Will Nifty scale to 24,000 in last 2 days of 2024? | Opening Bell
items.description: Frontline indices Sensex and Nifty managed to gain 1 percent each last week despite a thinly volume trade. A total of 32 Nifty stocks recorded gains last week, while Midcap index stayed flat. This week, macro-economic data, global cues, and FII flows will shape market movements. Majority of experts expect rangebound trade to continue this week as well, seeing Nifty's resistance at 24,000-24,200, with support placed around 23,650. This morning, global cues were mixed. US markets ended lower on Friday, while Asia Pacific markets started this morning on a mixed note. Among stocks in focus, watch out for JSW Energy, Utkarsh SFB, IOL Chemicals. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Osho Krishan, Sr. Analyst - Technical & Derivative Research, Angel One and Sandip Agarwal - Fund Manager, Sowilo Investment Managers.
